ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A specimen of pure germanium at 300 K has a density of charge carriers 2.5 × 1019/m3. It is doped with donor impurity atoms at the rate of one impurity atom every 106 atoms of germanium. All impurity atoms are supposed to be ionized. The density of germanium atom is 4.2 × 1028 atoms/m3. The resistivity of the doped germanium if electron mobility is 0.38 m2/V-s is _______× 10–3 Ω-m. (upto three decimal places)

Consider an N channel silicon FET with a channel width of 5.6 × 10–4 cm and a donor concentration of 1015/cm3. Given, the dielectric constant of Si is 12. Which of the following statements is/are correct?
ENGLISH.OPT1: FET is used in oscillator circuits because frequency drift is low.
ENGLISH.OPT2: FET is used as buffer in measuring instruments and receivers.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The pinch off voltage is 23.6 V
ENGLISH.OPT4: FET amplifiers have low gain bandwidth product.

Assume that the electron affinity and effective density of states in the conduction band of silicon are = 4.01 eV and NC = 2.8 × 1019/cm3 respectively. The potential difference Vn between the conduction band and Fermi level of the silicon in the bulk region is __________ V. (upto two decimal places) (Assume, VT = 25.9 mV)

The measured I-V characteristics of a Si diode maintained at room temperature is crudely sketched as shown in figure. Note that the current scale is logarithmic for forward bias and linear for reverse bias. Non idealities exhibited by the characteristics are identified by capital letters. Various possible sources for the deviations from the ideal are listed below the figure. Identify the cause of each non-ideal I-V feature; place the proper source number(s) adjacent to the letters on the sketch and select the correct option(s):

1. Photogeneration
2. Thermal recombination in the depletion region
3. Avalanche/Zener process
4. Low level injection
5. Depletion approximation
6. Thermal generation in the depletion region
7. Band bending
8. Series resistance
9.
10. High level injection
